title: Yasuo windwall change to no longer block ultimates
body:
Hey call me a hater, but is it not dumb that yasuo's windwall blocks like 30+ champ's ultimate abilities? I can kinda feel the aa blocking as ok... but does it really make sense that some wind will block a giant tidal wave, and like every skill shot in the game???

If we could change wind wall to just block aa, then ok maybe yasuo is then a balanced champion.

I could even live with malphite and zac just giving him faceroll ultimates on all 5 of ur team if u were foolish enough to clump up, as long as ashe could hit him with an arrow, or he couldn't block the entire reason miss fortune is a viable adc in solo q with a basic ability... he could at knock her up to end the channel anyway, that would be fair. Her ultimate is difficult enough to setup against a non-brain dead team comp, ya know? 

So like let yasuo build tanky with lifesteal, let him have 100% crit with 2 items, let him block basic range aa with windwall, but change windwall so it doesn't block ultimate abilities like nami's wave and then he is close to a balanced champ imo.

Sure man, just brainstorming a way to balance a controversial champ. :)

I can think of two possible changes that would be acceptable:

1. On the back-end, split Nami's ult into several separate segments (5-7?), so instead of one really wide segment, you have several narrow ones running in parallel. This way, the wind wall (or Braum's wall) could block part of her ult, while the rest of it continues past. 

2. Shorten the duration of wind wall. 3.75 seconds is a long time to have to hold your ult simply because wind wall exists in the general area you want to cast the ult. What's worse is that wind wall feels like it lasts slightly longer, because it still blocks stuff while it fades away. If any little bit of it still exists, it'll stop her entire ult. If wind wall only lasted 2 seconds, or even less, it'd feel more like the Yasuo has to choose what specific incoming spell he wants to prioritize blocking, rather than being able to just put it up during the fight and having a safe space to stand where he can't get hit by much. Like, Fiora's Riposte is a much better implementation of a blocking sort of spell in this regard.

i definitely agree with #2. That could be a smart and fair nerf. 

As for #1, I think it would be cool to see nami's wave actually behave like water and split apart over terrain and a wind wall or braums shield, but maybe that would be kinda broken and I don't think Riot would do it just for the sake of nami, especially since shes already a pretty good champ anyway.

I've felt like they should hit his wind wall's duration for a long time now. Also reduces the time he can stand inside of it and be basically invulnerable to most spell and ranged autos during laning. I'm fine with the wind wall blocking ults in general, just would rather it be more of a point of skill and timing to select what to block than simply sticking a wall up and being safe for nearly 4 seconds.

But #1 doesn't actually feel too far-fetched to me, even if Nami is already in a decent spot. I wouldn't go so far as having it interact with the terrain, though that'd be awesome. But all you have to do is experience the very edge of Nami's ult clipping wind wall and suddenly disappearing to see that there's an inherent problem with this interaction as it is. It may not be a huge problem now, but I'd almost say it's a must-change if they decide to put a similar blocking ability on even just one more new champion.

Nautilus's ult has some weird coding to it that makes it bypass windwall, Rumble's ult is only kind of sort of blocked by it in certain cases, and Vayne's ult is an AD steroid, what do you mean it gets blocked?

Edit: Windwall only blocks the projectile portion of Ahri's ult, not the dashes. 

Generally speaking, if an ability has a travel time, it counts as a projectile and thus gets blocked. Exceptions occur, but that's the rule of thumb. Furthermore, many abilities that involved objects coded as minons will stop at the wall but not be destroyed because the wall only axes the ability that causes the "minon" to move, hency why Taliyah's ult get stopped and why Azir's Q stops but his soldiers remain.

Maybe because Naut's ult is a AoE ground based attack?  I think AoE ults can work their way past the wall as long they don't target the wall as such.  For example, if Brand's ult hits a minion to the side of the wall, then it can spread behind the wall.

Just noting here, Rammus's ult also works too.  (It's lots of fun to fight Yas as Rammus - after constantly bullying and pushing in the little ground-dweller into his turret, he fires up the windwall and pokes the heck out of Rammus, only to be surprised to see that his health is steadily dropping as that ult just wears him down.)  Come to think of it, I still have to check and see if Amumu's tears get past the wall.

It's not strictly speaking like Rammus's ult, it's closer to Braum's if I recall. It's just that some "projectiles" can go over/under the windwall, with Zigg's ult being an example of the former and Naut's ult an example of the latter.
